Bryan_Martin_(singer):
{{Short description|American country singer}} {{Infobox musical artist | background = person | name = Bryan Martin | image = | image_upright = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Logansport, Louisiana]], U.S. | origin = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = Vocals | years_active = 2018–present | label = [[Average Joes Entertainment]] }} '''Bryan Martin''' is an American [[country music]] singer. In 2023 and 2024, Martin had his first charted entry with the single "[[We Ride (Bryan Martin song)|We Ride]]". ==Biography== Martin was born in [[Logansport, Louisiana]]. As a teenager, he worked on an [[oil rig]] in addition to playing [[American football]] and [[bull riding]]. He broke his collar bone doing the latter, after which he developed an addiction to [[painkiller]]s. After this, he briefly enlisted in the [[United States Army]] and, after an attempted suicide, began recording music.{{cite web | url=https://people.com/country/bryan-martin-wolves-cry-music-video-premiere/ | title=Bryan Martin on How Writing Music After Misfiring a Gun Saved His Life: 'I've Lived Through It' | publisher=People | date=January 27, 2023 | accessdate=April 15, 2024}} Martin released the albums ''If It Was Easy'' in 2019 and ''Self Inflicted Scars'' two years later. In late 2022, his song "We Ride", released through [[Average Joes Entertainment]], began receiving attention on [[TikTok]]. By 2023, "We Ride" had begun charting on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] charts, also reaching the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in early 2024. The song is on Martin's third album ''Poets & Old Souls''.{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/bryan-martin-hot-100-debut-we-ride-1235641406/ | title=Hot 100 First-Timers: Bryan Martin Scores His First Chart Hit With ‘We Ride’ | publisher=Billboard | date=March 26, 2024 | accessdate=April 15, 2024}}{{cite web | url=https://s3.amazonaws.com/bulletins.billboard.com/country/country_update_2024_0412.pdf | title=Billboard Country Update | publisher=Billboard | date=April 12, 2024 | accessdate=April 15, 2024}} Following the song's release, Martin was booked as an opening act for [[Morgan Wallen]] and [[Warren Zeiders]].{{cite web | url=https://tasteofcountry.com/bryan-martin-we-ride/ | title=Bryan Martin's rebellious side roams free in 'We Ride' [Listen] | publisher=[[Taste of Country]] | date=March 7, 2024 | accessdate=April 15, 2024}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== *''It Was Easy'' (2019) *''Self Inflicted Scars'' (2022) *''Poets & Old Souls'' (2023) ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |+List of singles, with selected peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Year ! scope="col" colspan="4"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| [[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]] ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Album |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%"| [[Billboard Hot 100|US]]
